tweet: You don't think Facebook has a user agreement? Besides, when is a labor contract so sacrosanct to the Left anyway?

If you "solve for the equilibrium" there, it just doesn't seem so fearful to me. And I don't spend any time on "Facebook the page" in fact.

I can choose my Facebook friends, but I can't really choose who emails me. Plus I can stare at WhatsApp or Instagram instead of the Facebook page, or choose which parts of the page, lots of control, no?

UK Amazon will ship! And with the cheaper pound, usually it doesn't cost much more than a US order.

Yes no tax break is better, but nonetheless a huge loss that Amazon didn't come, just as immigrants are a big gain for Queens. Comparison holds up. Not every subsidy to immigrants is a good idea, either.
That is not money NY is forking over, it is a credit against future taxes. With Amazon not coming the money simply is not there. And Medicaid is a major expense for NY/NYC!

You don't think immigrants are also receiving some local subsidies through Medicaid, public education, etc.? And by no means do all pay income tax. Amazon pays state tax, huge payroll tax, its workers pay income tax, partial incidence on Amazon.
How is it again that immigrants coming to Queens is good but Amazon coming is bad?,
I think a prediction market, with the value of Queens land contingent on whether Amazon comes, would yield a strongly positive answer. Related to Krugman's current agnostic thread on Amazon.
